sen.j: 中原 季時（なかはら の すえとき、？ - 1236年5月12日（嘉禎2年4月6日 (旧暦)））は平安時代末期から鎌倉時代前期にかけての武将。
sen.e: NAKAHARA no Suetoki (date of birth unknown - May 12, 1236) was a busho (Japanese military commander), who lived from the end of the Heian Period to the early Kamakura Period.

sen.j: 中原親能（藤原親能）の子。
sen.e: He was the son of NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi (Fujiwara no Chikayoshi).

sen.j: 源頼朝に仕え、朝幕関係の交渉役を務めた。
sen.e: He served MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and was in charge of coordinating the affairs between the Imperial Court and the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 1205年10月から京都守護に任じられて、山門騒動の鎮圧などに活躍した。
sen.e: In October 1205, he was appointed to Kyoto shugo (Military governor of Kyoto), and since then he actively perused his duties such as suppressing the Sanmon sodo (fray).

sen.j: 1221年に出家して行阿と号した。
sen.e: He entered into priesthood in 1221 and used a Buddhist name, Gyoa.

sen.e: When Jokyu War broke out in the same year, he held a fort in Kamakura as rusuiyaku (a person representing the master during his absence).
